title: Ridiculous
body: Just got chat restricted for absolutely no reason. One of the games I was toxic, I realize that. ONE. The other 2 strikes were outrageous! First of all, the 2nd game I was jokingly trash talking  with friends in my part, like "wow this teemo" TO MY FRIENDS. During that game, two players started trolling the game so we'd surrender so I responded with, "yeah just troll so you feel better about your score, good job man". 3rd strike was a game where I WAS TELLING THE PERSON TO STOP BEING TOXIC! The proof of my toxicty was me saying "STOP BEING AN ANGRY BEAR" "YOU ANGRY BEAR YOU" "STOP SMASHING WITH YOUR BEAR CLAWS", and "dude you're bronze because you're toxic" "you're score isn't great either so idk why you're being so toxic". So this is considered more toxic than most league players? Really? The tribunal is a joke.

replies.body:
I love it when people start by saying they got banned for no reason, and then follow immediately with the reason they got banned. 

In 6 years I have yet to receive a single warning or punishment. This is because I don't rage or flame or bitch. I worry about myself since that is all I can control.

Two of my strikes for extreme toxicity we're simply ridiculous. One was me jokingly being "toxic" to my irl friends in my party. The other was me telling a person that being toxic was making them a bad player, and that they're score wasn't good which meant they had no reason to be toxic.

You don't need to tell people they are toxic. It accomplishes nothing positive and is very likely to escalate the situation. Just mute them and report them at the end of the game and it'll be them coming in here and complaining about how the system is broken because their toxicity was not tolerated.

Maybe, but I'm the one now who is not going to get the 10 year gift, silver banner, etc, all because I tried telling a player to stop being toxic and tilting the entire team. I literally was trying to calm him down. Now here I am, and he is probably free. While I now can't get the 10 year gift :).

So we're back to square one? The reason you have lost these rewards is because of a pattern of negative attitude, not because "you told one player to stop being toxic". 

If you did report him, there is no reason to assume he is "probably free". If you think Riot is being too strict, then you have to understand that this guy who supposedly was worse than you should expect to receive a punishment too.

  I hate to sound like I lack compassion here, but other people's behavior is not an excuse for yours, you get punished for yours if enough people report you and he gets punished for his if enough people report him. It really is that simple. Mute, report, move on. 

 It's easy and WAY less stressful than engaging in a shit tossing match with some moron you'll never meet again.
Learn control.

The other players don't know or care that you are talking to your friends; there are other people there you need to be considerate of. If you want to trash talk your friends I recommend either playing in a full premade that doesn't mind and won't report you, or using a third party form of communication.

I suggest talking less and playing the game more; even if you are not specifically being negative, spending so much time chatting takes focus away from the game at hand and is at the very least an annoyance to the other players.

You think me saying "nathan shh you're bad kid" was the reason? No it wasn't. But that was the reason I was chat restricted. They trolled the game so we'd ff and they're not going to be punished, I am. Seems legit dude.

Don't add to the problem. This is what you need to take away from this chat restriction, if nothing else.

Edit: Oh, and it's just a measly chat restriction. You aren't losing your ranked rewards or anything (unless you choose not to work it off).

It's not about cursing. That is not the requirement for being an unsportsmanlike player.

And about telling trolls off, no, I don't do that. When I started this game in 2014 I got a single notification of reports against me, and that is all it took for me to realize that negative behavior is a problem and not acceptable here. I have been mature about it and simply muted them, reported, and moved on with my life since then.

Is there anything else you are confused about? I recommend figuring out what you're doing wrong now, because if you continue this behavior you will move up the path of escalation and receive more severe punishments, up to a permanent ban. I am here to help you do so, but if you only want to repeatedly claim that you've not been unsportsmanlike then nobody can help you.

I just don't understand how riot says in the ban, they understand that frustration happens but your chat has been determined to be way too toxic, way more than average. Which clearly it wasn't more toxic than average. I told people trolling the game to stop using it as an excuse of their playing. I did not rage.

Most people don't say much at all, and if they trash talk or rage a bit it's not all game in most of their games.

I highly recommend utilizing the mute button far more often and sooner; if a player is being rude in chat, they probably don't have much of use to say and can rely on pings instead.

If someone is trolling, there's not much you can do to stop them. If you approach them in a positive or neutral manner they may stop, but if you start giving them shit they are highly likely to step up their trolling game and probably direct it at you. Just consider this before approaching them so you can get the results you prefer (I assume you want them to stop trolling and play the game right). If they don't want to listen, the only thing you can do is do your best to play around them.
